text.0: as rain from out the cloud for you indra and agni from my soul.
text.1: this noblest praise hath been produced.
text.2: do ye o indraagni hear the singers call accept his songs.
text.3: ye rulers grant his hearts desire.
text.4: give us not up to poverty ye heroes indraagni nor.
text.5: to slander and reproach of men.
text.6: to indra and to agni we bring reverence high and holy hymn.
text.7: and craving help softwords with prayer.
text.8: for all these holy singers here implore these twain to succour them.
text.9: and priests that they may win them strength.
text.10: eager to laudyou we with songs invoke you bearing sacred food.
text.12: indra and agni come to us with favour ye who conquer men.
text.13: let not the wicked master us.
text.14: at no time let the injurious blow of hostile mortal fall on us.
text.16: whatever wealth we crave of you in gold in cattle or in steeds.
text.18: when heroes prompt in worship call indra and agni lords of steeds.
text.20: call hither with the song and lauds those who best slay the foemen those.
text.21: who take delight in hymns of praise.
text.22: slay ye the wicked man whose thought is evil of the demon kind.
text.23: slay him who stays the waters slay the serpent with your deadly dart.
